title: Implications for Seat Distrib in House of Reps

content.question: Which of the following is an implication for the governing parties in the Nigerian House of Representatives and Britain’s House of Commons?

choices.label: There is a much greater likelihood of a vote of no confidence and early elections in Nigeria’s House of Representatives than in Britain’s House of Commons.
Gridlock is more likely a result of divided government in Nigeria while in Britain gridlock would result from disagreements among the coalition partners.
Members of Britain’s House of Commons. are more likely to work with the president to pass legislation than are members of the Nigerian House of Representatives
Policy making will likely be more straightforward in the House of Representatives than in the House of Commons due to the threat of the prime minister’s veto power.

content.answer: Gridlock is more likely a result of divided government in Nigeria while in Britain gridlock would result from disagreements among the coalition partners.
